data.name: Scoring HTML Test Question
data.description:
# Question Computer Science students need to answer the following question on their test: > With the following lines one can create a valid HTML file. Write down the correct order of line numbers in which one can create a [valid HTML file](https://www.w3.org/TR/html52/introduction.html#a-quick-introduction-to-html) using all lines numbers below. > >| Line number | HTML | | --| --| | 1 | `` | | 2 | `` | | 3 | `` | | 4 | `` | | 5 | `` | | 6 | `` | | 7 | `Test` | | 8 | `

A Header

` | | 9 | `

This is a paragraph!

` | | 10 | `` | | 11 | `` | # Grading It is our task to grade this question: Bullets to check: 1. Add 1 point if `` is the first in the answer. 2. Add 1 point if the begin tag of `html` is previous to its endtag in the answer. 3. Add 1 point if the begin tag of `head` is previous to its endtag in the answer. 4. Add 1 point if the begin tag of `body` is previous to its endtag in the answer. If bullet 3 is true: - Add another 1 point if `` is in the `head` element
(i.e. `` should be previous to `` which is then previous to ``) - Add another 1 point if `Test` is in the `head` element If bullet 4 is true: - Add another 1 point if `

A Header

` is in the `body` element - Add another 1 point if `

This is a paragraph!

` is in the `body` element If bullets 2 & 3 are true: - Add another 1 point if the `head` begin- and endtag are in the `html` element If bullets 2 & 4 are true: - Add another 1 point if the `body` begin- and endtag are in the `html` element Add one final extra point if all 10 points above are obtained and if the `head` endtag is previous to the `body` begintag. --- # Input The input will be a `Tuple` containing a single student's answer which will be a *permutation* of all 11 HTML line numbers in the above question. --- # Output Return the amount of points the student should get for its answer. --- # Examples This is a completely valid example: `(5, 3, 1, 7, 4, 2, 10, 8, 9, 11, 6)` should return `11`
This example only gets points for bullets 1, 2, 3 and 4: `(5, 3, 1, 6, 10, 2, 11, 8, 9, 7, 4)` should return `4`
